Description: Fragment of lid of Attic black-figured pottery vase. Inside glazed; outside, part of band of rays around lost central knob, bounded by triple line; in outer frieze, winged female, head and wing only preserved, head to right; to the right, enigmatic object, curving, with added red including large circle with cross-incision; white for face and neck of female and dots on wing; red also on wing.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit takes the figure to be a sphinx, which would make the object on the right all the more difficult to explain for reasons of space; rather, she is a siren or a winged divine or mythological figure.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 84, no. 280, pl. 63)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2127)
